Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay for few days”
Reviews.Author: MilaMihailovna
Reviews.Content: All was good. We booked last twin room (two single rooms) throw booking.com, but by arriving we have proposed usual double room without extra payment. Hotel location not far from center. 5 minutes to the tram stop, and 2 stops to the Dam square. Breakfast was good. Wifi is perfect. Small room, but with nice bed. Nice place to stay for few days.

Reviews.Title: “"a super little hotel"”
Reviews.Author: Niallobyrne
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a two night stay in Amsterdam. I stayed at the Hampshire hotel in Prinsengracht. I wasn't too sure what to expect,but was very surprised. The hotel is lovely in a fantastic location, for walking around Amsterdam. Rooms are small, but more than good enough and the bathroom was spotless. I have stayed in other so called 4 star hotels in Amsterdam and they could not hold a candle to this gem. The staff were very helpful and friendly. I would certainly recommend this hotel and I will stay here on my next visit. This was a business trip , but I would have no problem return to this hotel with my wife. You are within walking distance of the Flower market,Rembrantsplein and the main shopping district.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and well located”
Reviews.Author: Lucy_getaway
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a room overlooking garden for 3 nights. Very peaceful and wonderful large windows looking into the garden. We had requested a triple room and were disappointed to find one bed (though king size) and an armchair that converted into a single bed (not very comfortable), which left little space for luggage. Despite this, we enjoyed our stay at the Prinsengracht. The location is fantastic - great selection of restaurants, bars, cafes within a few minutes walk and close to Rembrandt Square. The staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Canal side house”
Reviews.Author: Bob A
Reviews.Content: Although over reviews of this hotel have praised the view etc my experience was the opposite I had a tiny room at the back of the hotel where i could touch both walls with outstretched arms Room smelt of damp and was very quiet so a good nights sleep but tiny TV and poor quality are my lasting memories of this place

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: skyla4
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in the garden annex in October 2011. No problems whatsoever staff friendly and helpful, rooms clean and good size. Staying in the annex is lovely as its in the garden and nice and quiet. Very useful having wireless Internet. Best thing about the hotel though is its location - close to everything. We walked most places when it wasn't raining! And staff always happy to book you a taxi if needed! Very picturesque location on one of the many canals. Would stay here again as it was very reasonably priced - we booked direct through the hotels website.

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay..& I will be back!”
Reviews.Author: deveryl Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 2 years ago...& definitely had it in mind when I was going again this year. Clean...friendly staff...decent breakfast...great location. The rooms are a bit pokey...but I'm assuming not too many of the rooms in Europe aren't. Definitely serves its purpose for a solo traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Blanca79
Reviews.Content: I actually chose this hotel because it was really close to one of the main channels in Amsterdam. I ended up being really central and that gave me wings to walk a lot and get to know the surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Darius H
Reviews.Content: I had a great time at the hotel. For the price and location you really can't complain. I think other people need to stop there bitc#$ing and complaing and do their research before booking and have some FREAKING COMMON SINCE. I was at the hotel for PRIDE and as an Amercian from New York City I thought it was fanstastic for the location and price.........for my needs. I plan on staying there again in 2012. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Cancelled my room by mistake and then charged me!”
Reviews.Author: James C
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here once before, which was absolutely fine - nice hotel, nice staff etc. However, on my recent visit I rang up in the morning to see if there would be a cancellation fee (as due to a change in work plans it was a bit out of the way). They said there would be, so I said ok don't worry i'll see you later today. I then called back in the evening to say I was going to be checking in later than I stated when I booked and they said they had to record of my booking. Anyway, they had clearly misunderstood me and cancelled my room. They then proceeded to charge me and would not accept that it was clearly a mistake (on their part). Very unreasonable and extremely poor communication about the whole issue. Real shame, as I would have stayed here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: kezhaslam
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights, the hotel staff were very friendly. We were on the top floor, number 507, the room was very clean with brew making facilities and a double bed. The hotel is in a brilliant location and it didn't take us long to stumble across the first bar for a quick drink. On our return to the room we found that it was very hot, we both slept on top of the bedsheets in an attempt to keep us cool. This was not a problem, it was the middle of July. The hotel is in the middle of Dam Square and Albert Cuyp Market. It's easliy walking distance but the trams are on the main road and pass every 10mins. I would stay again for the location alone!

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: gaugin-100
Reviews.Content: I had a very comfortable stay here. The female staff were friendly and the hotel is located in a quiet area away from the crowds. Don't expect a pretty view from the room though. The breakfast is expensive and some very nice canal-side cafes are nearby instead. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: didaka
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only 10 minutes walking distance from Dam Square, Rembrandtplein and Museum District. It it also very close to the tram stop. The room was very small and basic but it was clean and was facing the canal. I booked a twin room and I was very surprised when I received two keys at the reception desk. The girl told me that their twin rooms are the so called standard Dutch rooms i.e. they consist of two different very tiny rooms with a common bathroom. The staff was quite helpful. The hotel is the perfect for a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Good Basic Hotel in nice quiet location.”
Reviews.Author: Dubliner006
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the reviews here. It does exactly what it says on the tin, so we were happy with our choice. We wanted a central hotel, not too expensive that we could get out and about exploring. We asked for and got a double room overlooking the Canal. You can hear the lift as someone mentioned but it didn't disturb our sleep. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel so can't comment. Our room was small clean and adequate, Our only gripe was our bathroom door was broken and was a very flimsy fold over door so no privacy!! Staff were very nice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, nice hotel, but rubbish sleep!”
Reviews.Author: elleSearcher
Reviews.Content: Positive: This hotel was in a great location on a central yet fairly quiet street (Prinsengracht). It was the perfect base for discovering the city on foot. Was on a Room Only basis so didn't eat at the hotel. Reception staff were friendly. The room was basic but acceptable. Negative: The main problem was that the room was next to the stairwell. As the stairs were wooden, you could hear everyone going up and down and this resulted in rubbish sleep on all 3 nights for me (boyfriend is not a light sleeper so he wasn't affected). I had to buy some earplugs. If you book there and you are on the first floor, at the rear of the property in the corner you may have the same noise issues. Sorry I can't remember the room number.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: valeriasanf
Reviews.Content: the hotel is nice, but my room was quite little and a little cold for me. the place is perfect: Prinsengracht is beautiful and surroundings are really nice, is close to the centre but quite. you can just wait outside the hotel and in some minute a bus will come and take you to the central station.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean good value”
Reviews.Author: sydneytraveller5000
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights. Our room was big and clean and had a view over the canal. We got a taxi from the train station as it was only 10E. It was in a great location 10 min walk to everything. We didn't take breakfast at the hotel so cant comment. We also hired bikes for the day for 10E. The staff were friendly. Amsterdam is Amsterdam and this Hotel is a Hotel. We got a clean room, clean bathroom, friendly service it was very good value for money. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff - Basic Rooms”
Reviews.Author: DasuTraveler
Reviews.Content: Good location on the canal. Staff was very friendly, all shifts. Breakfast was adequate, more than just cold cereal and meats. Rooms seemed small and basic but that was enough for us since we spent our time out exploring. We enjoyed watching the boats float by on the canal.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean, friendly central location”
Reviews.Author: Lane2008
Reviews.Content: We spend a few days here in April and found the Hampshire Inn to be ideal for our short city break. Almost all the sights that we wished to see were within walking distance, the location is ideal. Our room was clean, serviced daily and faced onto the canal which was lovely. The staff could not have been more helpful and friendly. Would definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good but could do better”
Reviews.Author: jennykenny
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant hotel, friendly staff, fairly central, nice bars and restaurants close by, reasonable breaksfast, nice little back garden, but bathroom needed a thorough makeover. Blocked sink (fixed when I complained about it), no plug in sink, no extactor fan and black mould that needs removing. Very few people staying in mid March but heavy footsteps from the floor above - I think it could be noisy in high season. Tram number 4 from Central Station takes you to the end of the road - ask to be put off at Prinsengracht - about 4 minutes walk from there. Amsterdam is not known for local food - stick to Indonesian or Thai.

Reviews.Title: “A nice return.”
Reviews.Author: fgargax
Reviews.Content: I was back in this hotel after a long period passed there for business in 1998 and I found all as I left. Rooms are nothing exceptional but the service is great.

Reviews.Title: “A little investment would help”
Reviews.Author: frantic291
Reviews.Content: Well I have just returned from my annual New Years stay at the Hampshire Inn. I have stayed in the same room ( 501) during the holidays for quite a few years now ( 7 or 8+). The room is very small compared to others I have stayed in and nothing has changed ;same carpet, same drapes ,same broken soap dish in the shower. It wouldn't' take much to fix this place....but. I think they get the 3 star rating by averageing 4 star staff with a 2 star facility. I feel like family there so I'll give them one last chance in 2010. The location and views are without comparison.There are great places to eat all close by.

Reviews.Title: “Aweful”
Reviews.Author: James1985
Reviews.Content: I booked this place for myself and my girlfriend for a quiet weekend away in Amsterdam. The general reviews of the place seemed very good. The reception looked nice enough, but upon going round the corner and being hit by the stench of a poorly drained reception toilet and tired looking elevator things began to turn sour. Our double room turned out to be little more than a shoebox - just large enough for the bed, with dirty bare walls and a very basic shower/bathroom. We were also placed on the 5th (top) floor, and it was extremely hot from rising heat, despite it being very cold outside and having the windows open. I went to ask for a room change and the staff member was completely uninterested saying they were full. He then said that they had overbooked for the following night and so would be doing them a favour if i left and found somewhere else to stay! This would have been a good option, but i didn't wish to spend the precious little time we have there looking for a new hotel, so we stayed. The bed was uncomfortable and it was very hot at night. I also have a number of bites over my body, but can't say for sure that they were from the bed. The wifi did not work and the staff provided no solutions or apologies. This hotel would not reach 1star in the UK, let alone 3star! I wonder if the other reviewers were staying in the same hotel! I reccommend not staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location, with free wireless internet”
Reviews.Author: sergio2008
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights because they had a competitive online rate (but need to shop around different sites to find best rate), and this hotel is still at walking distance to the interesting areas in the city centre, unlike others at similar rates which are typically located well into the suburbs. The (single) room was small but adequate, on the fifth floor (room 501) overlooking the Prinsengracht canal and the general area. Funnily enough the room key was a normal key, not an electronic one, which is a bit surprising these days, also from a security perspective. However I had no problems at all during my stay. The room also had an electronic safe. Other items in the room included a working desk, clothes storage, and a small flat-panel TV. The hotel also offers free wireless internet which is a definite bonus, as some other hotels in Amsterdam still charge rates up to 20 euros or more per day for internet access, which is ridiculous. So this is a great initiative of this hotel and is of sufficient value to me to make me come back here in future. There are four access points in the hotel, ensuring good quality wireless. You can get the passkey from reception. The mattress was on the soft side (softer than any hotel I have stayed at in the past year or two) and the pillow too was a bit too soft for my taste, however I still managed a good nights sleep. The bathroom was adequate, with a decent shower (although nothing exceptional). Staff were very friendly, and went out of their way to make my stay a pleasant one. Overall a good hotel for its price and location, which I would like to recommend and will likely return to in future.

Reviews.Title: “Great quiet location near the city centre”
Reviews.Author: irishtravelmonkey
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights at the start of July, I got a double room for â‚¬70 a night which when I was booking at the last minute was cheaper than any single room I could find close to the city centre. The location was my favourite thing about it, it's about 20 minutes walk from the centre but along a very quiet canal, I never heard any noise from the street on any of the nights there. The room was simple but comfortable and clean, I was impressed with the en-suite which was big for a hotel of this class. In the room there seemed to be a lot of noise coming from people walking on the stairs above but luckily this was never enough to wake me up so it didn't bother me that much. The staff were very friendly and efficient too when I was arriving and checking-out. Overall I was very happy with my stay here and I will definitely consider staying here again the next time I'm in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: porthcawl
Reviews.Content: Hi the hotel is ok, but not what we expected at all. You can get much better for your money in Amsterdam.Plusses:-location- right on prinsengrachtgarden- really tranquilMinusses-Rooms were not great, sparse, and shower no bath. WE stayed in a superior room and it really wasn't that.No restaurant- or even snack barBar- this is a fridge not a bar with steep proices- 6 euros for a bottle of water.In terms of value for moeny it is expensive and you can get much better in the city than this.

Reviews.Title: “The best keep secrets in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: nathpek
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel without reading any review, and what a great surprise. We were 2 adults and 2 teens, and we booked the house garden. Very nice rooms, with coffee/tea apparatus, and a table in the garden, we spend some time there with a bootle of wine, wonderful feeling in the middle of town. 3 mn walk from Rembrandt square. Great breakfast and very nice people at the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Ideal”
Reviews.Author: SusieReds
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for 3 nights. We booked through Airmiles and got a good deal, worked out very cheap. The location of the hotel was ideal for us, fairly central to everything we wanted to do. The room was very small, but the bathroom was a fair size. There was a very small desk area and a single wardrobe, no drawer space so we ended up living out of our suitcases. Apart from the disappointment with the size of the room and lack of storage I can't fault the staff or the service they provided. The room and bathroom were kept clean, sheets were changed daily as were the towels. The breakfast, although not a great choice, was enough to see us through until lunch. The staff were always helpful and happy to provide extra pillows and bedding if required. For a short break, I would recommend it - especially if you get a good deal. It's an ideal base but not somewhere to spend long periods in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault the place.”
Reviews.Author: Lauryn4u2nv
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel earlier than we could check in by so they let us leave our luggage in a locked store room & we went off to explore the surroundings. We came back around 1pm-ish and checked in, no problems, nothing. They mentioned we had booked the deluxe room (i didnt know- didnt care as long as i had a bed) and asked if we wanted single beds instead, we said no it was fine. The room was HUGE, well not huge, but larger than your average hotel room! It was clean and neat and tidy. The bathroom was small but not crazy small, still a decent size with a shower, no bath. The sink was small and there was no much leg room when you were on the toilet but it was nothing major. There was a flat screen plasma TV on the wall & they had decent channels. Also supplied tea and coffee in the room. Either side of the bed were small wardrobes attached. The windows opened as sometimes we had the heating turned up without realising. They supplied breakfast, which was not compulsory, it was decent, not a lot of choice but it was decent enough to fill you for a few hours, you have to pay extra when you check out - ALSO dont forget the City Tax too!! The location wasnt too bad, there were a lot of coffee shops nearby (as always) Dam Square was around a 25 min walk away, dependin how fast you walk, or you can take the tram which was 1euro 20 or so, not a lot. The Red Light District was a little further than Dam Square, ironically a hard place to find until you actually SEE the Red Lights. Its a fascinating place to go though (i didnt wanna leave & im a girl) We took the tram to the Red Light & got off at the end of the line. Be weary of yourself & your belongings, its creepy at night even though it is full of people. We got the tram back rather than walking. Also the road the hotel is on, you are able to jump on a blue bus called Stop&Go which goes literally in a huge circle, we used this to get to Anne Frank's house, its only 1Euro & u can get on and off for most of the day with the same ticket!! Brilliant! Eating out for us consisted of Subway, we were on a budget and werent really too fussed about eating in restaurants but there are a few "pubs" and retaurants in the vicinity. Cigarettes are cheap too (B&H Silvers around 4 euros - may have changed now, so dont quote me) Worth the stay & i would definately stay again!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Quiet & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: susiedee3
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Hampshire and were very impressed. Receptionists were always friendly and helpful. Booked a double room but were upgrade to a Superior on arrival. The room was lovely and clean - recently re-furbished and overlooked the canal. The hotel is quiet because it is a bit out of the way of the main attractions but everything is in walking distance or reception will give you details of the trams. This was our third visit to Amsterdam so we knew where the hotel was in relation to everything so it didn't worry us. Walk to Central Station is about 35mins. Breakfast is typically continental but was of a good standard with plenty of choice.

Reviews.Title: “smelly and a long way from the station”
Reviews.Author: parityerror
Reviews.Content: Location: The hotel was about 35 minutes walk from Amsterdam Central station. It was raining when I arrived, so this was a fun walk. It is situation on the Prinsengraght Canal, the area had some nice character. Very quiet at night time (no drunks, etc) Check-in: There were a few groups who arrived at the same time, so it took about 5 minutes, but jsut bad timing, generally smooth. Room: The bathroom smelt strongly of perspiration, I think it was coming from the exhaust system. I left the external windows open all day (although room-service shut them) which cleared some of the smell. The bed was very small and matress was hard. Smoking: There are signs up everywhere advising that smoking is not tolerated. On several occasions I went downstairs to find the hotel staff smoking in the lobby. I guess it is OK for the hotel to break their own rules. Tours: Be careful of the guides in the rooms. On several occasions the pricing was wrong. Not hugely. The guide said it would cost 10 Euro to rent a bicycle from the hotel, they charged $12.50. The brochure also mentioned a canal cruise for $10. When I showed it to then cruise operators, they explained the brochure was outdated and the price had increased to $12. The bike I hired was good but had no gears and only pedal-brakes (ie pedal backwards to stop). This took some getting used to. Facilities: The hotel internet was very expensive, five Euro for 30 minutes. The ironing board and iron had to be borrowed from downstairs, there was no iron or board in the room. Overall: I should have stayed in a hostel. I know for next time.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Jackvic
Reviews.Content: We unfortunately had to stay here one night because of a mix up on our main hotel in Amsterdam. It was indeed a less than pleasant place. The room was drab, mattresses soft with age and, given the price, no air conditioning. Could not recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Barretina
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and we got a great room facing the little back-garden (as we had previously asked them on the web booking). The room was clean and spacious and the staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful at all times. We found the location of the hotel to be perfect because it is in a quiet street facing one of the main canals, far enough from the busy and noisy centre of town, but at the same time it is very close to tram lines and, if you like walking, you can get to the main attractions on foot no problem. The two main museums of Amsterdam (Van Gogh & Rikjsmuseum) are within walking distance, only 10 mins away. Would definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Mostly a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: MrsHelsinki
Reviews.Content: It was so cool to ask for the key 007, which led to a tiny room facing the backside to the house. Not the view I had hoped for, but not everyone can have the canal view I guess. Well, no one was really hanging in the garden yet in early april so it was ok. The room was very "optimized" for two adults: not more than 50 cm around the double bed anywhere, the window sill ended up as the best storage facility, there was one cupboard to hang clothes but it had only one shelf. A + for the safe tough. The bathroom was almost as big as the room itself and I have nothing to complain about it. After some searching I found even the hairdryer located under the tiny table, but they would have been happy to borrow me one from the reception too if needed. The house is over two hundred years old so the walls do not keep the souds off very well. The most disturbing sounds were perhaps the thumping of the stairs every time someone climbed them. There was also the occasional sound of the elevator or the plumbing, but they did not prevent us from sleeping very well. I liked the lobby / breakfast room very much and the breakfast included everything we wanted. It was served until 11 which was nice since we were looking for some R&R. The location has been mentioned many times and it is indeed very good, in a beautiful, peaceful neighbourhood away from the bustle of the tacky tourist traps. It's still very reachable either with trams ( 4 or 16, 24 or 25) or by walking. We ended up taking a taxi from Centraal at arrival because Google Maps located the addres s somewhere around Jordaan (the 100 something numbers at Prinsengracht, not the thousands it should really be) and I hadn't printed a map when booking. The staff was friedly an all of them spoke exellent english. They booked us an table at the Indonesian restaurant Indrapura (which I really can recommend). We dined in the neighbouring Cafe des Fles and Pieter De Leeuwe and were not disappointed. Some mixed feelings but all in all a pleasant stay and I would recommend the place, though not for budget travellers. We paid around 140 â‚¬ / double / night including breakfast. The fee for using their wlan would have been 10â‚¬ / 24h but we found a free one on the corner which was enough to keep our iPod & emails updated ;-) every time we walked by to the tram stop.

Reviews.Title: “Decent 2* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Davey1800
Reviews.Content: My second stay in a few weeks. Same as last time really.. a simple, clean room within a quiet hotel. I stayed in room 502 on the top floor and had a good view over the canal. There was half decent storage for the solo traveller, a safe, coffee/tea facilities, a very spacious bathroom (for a smallish room) and it was quiet of a night. There was also a hairdrier, soaps and shampoo in the bathroom, plenty of towels and an LCD TV with some decent channels. I paid for the hotel via lastminute.com, but when I checked in this time, the manager told me there was a "tourist tax" to pay at the end of my stay. I've heard nothing about this before, and wasn't asked for it last time I stayed. But I managed to leave the hotel without paying. Well, I threw the key at the reception and ran off when I checked out!! The room was kept clean over my two night stay by the efficient cleaning staff. The room had a radiator, as well as another in the bathroom, which heated up very quickly. The window to the room opened wide, which was great for the views and for air circulation (which would be handy in summer). All in all, a decent 2* hotel. Clean and tidy rooms and within 10-15 minutes brisk walk of the main Damrak tourist area.

Reviews.Title: “Straightfoward hotel ideal for RAI and centre”
Reviews.Author: Holiday_Mike
Reviews.Content: Pleasant, efficient greeting on arrival and room was available at lunchtime. Reasonable size, clean comfortable room. (Upgraded from a single to a double - nice surprise when I got to room). Proper windows that could be opened. Fully functional decent shower and WC. Toiletry selection provided. Tea and coffee in room and more happily provided on request. I prefer a firm bed and this one was just a bit on the soft side but not bad. TV with good selection of channels. Although I didn't need it, I had thought wifi access was free but there was a notice in reception indicating a charge. However , it was per day rather than by the hour. Quiet street and no noise within hotel itself from guests or lift. Breakfast is typical Netherlands hotel style - bread, cheese, cold meat, eggs, fruit, cereal, yoghurt and coffee/tea. Good locaton for visitors to exhibitions at the RAI or city centre - tram stop for route 4 is only a short walk. (If you're going to RAI, don't go all the way to Station RAI - get off at Dindelstraat or Europaplein) Room rate reasonable during a major trade show - worth looking at RAI schedule to avoid their dates for cheaper prices if you're planning being there weekdays. 'Average' grade given because you get what you pay for but nothing wrong with it at all. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Simple Hotel”
Reviews.Author: boozingfamilyman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a bunch of lads, each with their own single room. Rooms are tiny, basic and very clean but have everything you need, - ensuite, lcd tv, even a safe. Had a good nights sleep. Not sure if 60 GBP / night is too much but otherwise, would definately stop here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre hotel with a noisy elevator”
Reviews.Author: MazaFin
Reviews.Content: Positive things: 1. The hotel is situated so that you can go by foot to every place in Amsterdam. There are also tram stations very near if you don't like to walk. 2. The staff was very nice and especially the dark haired man with eyeglasses was a real gentleman. 3. Breakfast was ok. Nothing special but ok. Negative things: 1. The elevator is VERY noisy. It even keeps noise when it doesn't move! Our room was in the 5th floor and the elevator engine kept strange pumping voice which could be heard about once in 3 minutes or so. It kept us awake during the night. It was absolutely terrible and spoiled our stay. 2. The bed was awful. It seemed 20 years old. 3. Room was very small. I wouldn't say that it was filthy but not very comfortable. Bathroom had lots of room. Bigger than usual.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at the Hampshire Inn Prinsengracht”
Reviews.Author: optimystic
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a four night stay at the Hampshire Inn Prinsengracht. I paid 105EUR per night for a single room, not including breakfast and taxes. I thought this to be quite expensive, but it was high season and one of the cheapest rooms I could find. Lets start with the positives. The hotel is in a lovely location on Prinsengracht, a very picturesque canal. It is quiet and you can have your window open in the evening with no noise at all. Front rooms overlook the canal; I had a room overlooking the rear residental gardens - very pleasant. It is quite far (approx 30 mins walk) to Centraal Station, but I used the trams (either take Tram 4 to Prinsengracht or 16,24 or 25 to Keizersgracht) to reach it with my luggage easily. It is close to many of the main sights in Amsterdam, Leidesplein, Rembrantsplein, Museumplein are easily walkable. Anne Frank Huis is an enjoyable 20 minute walk along Prinsengracht. The room: I had a single room. Unsurprisingly quite small, but I did not spend much time in the room. Simply furnished, they could do with a refurb but are adequate and I could not fault the cleaniness. Flat screen TV, which received many channels from all over Europe, it was great for me to have the BBC channels, especially as my stay was during Wimbledon! Shower room was clean and the shower worked well. Slight negative - they use shower curtains which aren't as nice as a cubicle with a screen. Breakfast: typical continental breakfast with bread and pastries, fruit salad and yoghurts, cheeses and meats. Good start to the day. Hotel communal areas: Very pleasant bar and breakfast area - that is furnished nicely with a modern feel - leading out into a lovely garden which residents can use. However, the hallways upstairs are rather dull and dated, similar to the rooms. The main negative here was that noise from the hallways travels into the rooms quite easily so it can disturb you if other guests come back to their room late. Staff: Very helpful and friendly. I had an issue with the tuning on my TV but it was fixed fairly quickly. Summary: Great location, simple but clean rooms. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Pamitriki
Reviews.Content: The location is excelent, in the heart of the city, near to all the turist attractions but in a very peaceful area, just we were looking for but I think is so expensive for the value, we pay 150â‚¬ / day non included breakfast. The rooms are smalls, clear and comfortables and they have a good views at the canal or the garden. The desk people were so kind with us, they move from one twin room (two single rooms joined by a door) to a twin room when they have a vacancy! No problem to left our baggage there after the chek out. We do the reservations in the hotel web, it was the cheapest site where we find it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: Flaming0
Reviews.Content: We had a single, twin and double room at the Hampshire/Prinsegracht hotel - all rooms were great and the twin is actually two rooms with a connecting door, so a good budget option if you'd rather not pay for two singles. Pretty setting, very quiet with good views and the breakfast was served in a bright room looking into the garden. The location is perfect with many restaurants and bars within walking distance but on a quiet canal away from the sleaze. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “2nd year in a row...”
Reviews.Author: drbmbay
Reviews.Content: this was the 2nd year in a row I stayed at this hotel. really enjoyed the stay. quiet rooms, nice views (front and back). it's on a quiet canal street, just far enough away that you can feel you are in a neighborhood, but close enough to be able to walk to the leidseplein or hop a tram anywhere you want to go. the staff is very pleasant and helpful. the breakfast is okay, but you may want to just walk up the block to the bagel place and feel like a local.

Reviews.Title: “Prinsengracht - it was ok”
Reviews.Author: Ecomo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Prinsengracht for a conference in February 2006. Our room was on the top floor with quite old furniture, there were no such extra things like shampoo in the bathroom. Also the mattress was really old and not very comfortable. The bed was quite small, more like a bed for one person. We stayed one day longer than we planned to do and had to change rooms in order to do this. The other room was much better, we got soap and better mattresses. The people working at the hotel were always friendly and helpful. The breakfast is included in the price and therefore it is ok. No culinary delight, but nothing to walk away either. I loved the hard boiled eggs.

Reviews.Title: “"Liked" the Prinsengracht”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not a lot to say about this one. It was okay. Room was small but pleasantly situated overlooking a garden. Quiet room, tiny shower, nice old building. Overall not bad at all, but maybe a bit expensive for the hospitality. Breakfast maybe a bit boring, but adequate. Lift is nice addition. No air conditioning in our room but radiators for heating. Overall very nice, mainly because of great location, safe feeling. 3 stars. -

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: apple&pearMelbourne
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights at the Hampshire Inn Prinsengracht Hotel (seems to go by both names) for around $80EURO per night including breakfast (ratestogo.com). In general, I was quite happy with my stay there. While the room was small, I didn't have any problems with the presentation, and it had a lovely big window at end of my bed which I could open and lean out (from the 5th floor) to overlook the back garden area and neighbouring houses. Each night as I slept with the window open you could hear the melodic church bells sounding - quite atmospheric, and not too noisy (generally 'out-of-the-way' residential type area). It is located within the centre of the southern canal belt, within easy walking distance to the main museums, tourist areas and restraunt/entertainment hot-spots. Don't fuss about not being too close to Central Station as this area is a little dodgy and very touristy, plus, due to large scale construction work in the middle of the main road here (for a subway line I think) it isn't all that pretty/atmospheric or interesting. Staff spoke great english, were helpful and pleasant. There is a supermarket around 300m north of the hotel (although no minibar in room). The garden out the back of the hotel is lovely for an afternoon relax with a book, or for breakfast in the morning. Breakfast itself was simple (bread, ham, boiled egg, cereal, twofruits, tea/coffee) but adequate if you are getting it including in your rate.

Reviews.Title: “underwhelming hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jaje01
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at the last minute and expectations were not particularly high. We were prepared for the fact that the rooms seemed rather basic from the pics on the hotels website and read some of the comments on here before we left. Unfortunately, there just wasn't much accommodation still available in Amsterdam so we opted for this. We booked online and paid 360 euros for 3 nights in a standard room inc breakfast and taxes. We were given a ground floor room which was slightly damp and had no ventilation in the bathroom - the smell from the toilet was pretty grim - really not acceptable. The staff were apologetic and helpful - they arranged for us to be moved to a superior room for a slightly increased cost (25 euros per night), since no other rooms were available. I can't fault the service of the hotel staff, but the hotel was plain and uninspired much more like a 2* hotel, to be honest. Wallpaper was marked, furniture scuffed in places and stained. in all, a rather tired hotel that is in need of updating and a makeover. Breakfast was OK - very much the usual tourist 'continental' fayre that is served up. We won't stay here again - for what ended up costing almost 450 euros it was simply not worth the money. Booking earlier and getting a good price would certainly have made things better, but there you go... On the plus side, the hotel is in a great location. Its away from many of the noisey tourist traps and close to some fabulous restaurants. I wouldn't be in a hurry to recommend it, but if there is little available and location is more important than amenities, this might be for you.

Reviews.Title: “What, no coffee??”
Reviews.Author: Pyper
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 31st March to 4th April. We were expecting small from other reviews but really dissappointed with how small the room & shower were. Also no tea/coffee making facilities in the room. This was surprising for a 3* hotel. The staff were pleasant although not in an over the top way. Also the weather was fantastic on our visit. Plenty to do & see. My main tip would be take a good pair of walking shoes.

Reviews.Title: “Hmm...things seem to have changed for the worse”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I always read the reviews on Tripadvisor before booking a hotel in a town or city I am not familiar with. Generally I have found the tripadvisor reviews to be most helpful. However on this occasion I cannot agree with the earlier reviews. My room was very small, had cheap nylon carpets and walls that had been overpainted a few times too often. The reception staff were friendly but on two separate occasions gave incorrect opening times to local attractions. When I came to check out I was charged local taxes, despite having booked through lastminute at an all inclusive price. (Lastminite have since confirmed that the price paid did indeed include all taxes and breakfast.) The manager was very rude and aggressive when I queried the charges for local taxes and did not apologize when she was proved incorrect. The location is good and if you can get a room at a really cheap price this hotel might be worth considering. Generally there are far better hotels for just a few pounds more in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very helpful & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SteveMolyneux
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel is in an excellent location, 5 minutes from the Rembrandtsplein & overlooking the Prinsengracht canal. There is a small but pretty & peaceful garden where breakfast can be taken, weather permitting. The rooms are small but adequate & the staff very friendly & helpful. One thing to be aware of is that being near a canal, there are quite a few mosquitos around so take some repellent or get bitten ! The Rijksmuseum is only about 10 minutes walk & there are lots of restaurants nearby. L'Expresse & Le Quartier Latin are two good French restaurants that we visited.

Reviews.Title: “The most wonderful little hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel Prinsengracht 3 times over the last 2 years, and plan to stay there again in December of this year. I understand that it is now part of the Hampshire Hotel Group, which can only add to its already stellar reputation, in my opinion. Beautiful location, beautiful hotel and, most of all, an incredibly warm and friendly staff. Bernard

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scotcan12
Reviews.Content: Just back from a trip which started with a week at the Hampshire Inn Prinsengracht .... a great start! The location is fabulous, right on a quiet but very pretty stretch of the canal within easy walking distance of the museums and Dam Square.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Prinsengracht Hotel is beautiful, it's small, quaint and very clean. The staff are lovely and we thoroughly recommend it to anyone looking for a really friendly welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Prinsengracht Hotel is a very small hotel, but this is what makes it so charming and cozy. I spent two nights at this hotel and it felt like a week. I was so relaxed. The people in Amsterdam are so freindly; in my opinion, the nicest people in Europe. The people at the hotel all speak English and they will do anything to help you. The rooms are a bit small, but extremelly clean and modern. This hotel is located right in front of a major canal which only adds to the charm. During the time of my stay, breakfast was included in the price of the room. I will never forget the smell of freshly brewed coffee, eggs, and bread as was coming down the stairs. The breakfast area is also small, but the decoration (garden) is so beautiful, almost like a smaller version of a conservatory. This is defenetly a place I would visit again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hampshire Hotel - Prinsengracht
HotelInfo.Address: Prinsengracht 1015, Amsterdam 1017 KN, The Netherlands
